alert.note: Alert for Ashland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 11:50AM EST until March 06 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southern Ashland County. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1139 AM EST, Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain has fallen yesterday, which is causing ongoing flooding today. At 10:45 AM EST, the river gage on the Black Fork in Loudonville reported a river stage of 9.96 inches. Flood stage is 10 inches. - At a river stage of 10 inches, the Mohican River will be at bankful through much of Loudonville. Some low lying campgrounds near the river could see some minor inundation. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Loudonville and Perrysville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
